newsitem.title: UK: FOCUS - Portugal has chance to join EMU - agency.
newsitem.headline: FOCUS - Portugal has chance to join EMU - agency.

text.p: Credit agency IBCA gave Portugal an AA minus rating on Thursday, below the AAA grade of some other European nations but reflecting a better chance of joining the single currency than other southern European countries.
The European rating agency said in a statement that its first formal sovereign rating of Portugal applied to some $12.9 billion of senior and unsecured foreign currency debt.
"The rating reflects the swift modernisation that has taken place in the Portuguese economy since its accession to the European Union in 1986," IBCA said.
Structural reform through privatisation, falling inflation and relatively high economic growth had helped to boost Portuguese living standards to 70 percent of the EU average, IBCA said.
Although the country has yet to establish a long track record in sound fiscal management, its recent performance had been impressive and contributed to a positive outlook for the rating, IBCA said.
"The general government deficit as a percentage of GDP is set to have come in below target in 1996, and should meet the Maastricht criterion in 1997.

"While the debt to GDP ratio will fall outside the Maastricht limit and there is a risk that the same will happen with inflation, Portugal stands a better chance than other southern Europeans of early membership of monetary union in 1999."
Prime Minister Antonio Guterres said on Tuesday that Portugal was unflinching in its determination to join the European Union's single currency at its planned launch in 1999.

His remarks followed reports that Dutch Finance Minister Gerrit Zalm had cast doubts on Lisbon's ability to qualify for Economic and Monetary Union (EMU) from the start. The Netherlands currently holds the EU presidency.
The Portuguese parliament recently approved the Socialist government's 1997 budget plan calling for a deficit of 2.9 percent of Gross Domestic Product (GDP), inside the three percent EMU ceiling.
